body:
As a user I want to have microarchitecture specific flags injected for Intel compilers so that I would compile by default code that is optimized for the target of the installation.

### Rationale

We already support this feature for GCC since #3206 and need to extend the capability to other compilers as well

### Description
What needs to be done is carefully reviewing docs and man pages, and encode in [this file](https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/lib/spack/llnl/util/cpu/microarchitectures.json) the information found.



### Additional information
A non exhaustive list of pages we might want to consult:

- [Intel C++ compiler Reference](https://software.intel.com/en-us/cpp-compiler-developer-guide-and-reference)
- [Intel Fortran compiler Reference](https://software.intel.com/en-us/fortran-compiler-developer-guide-and-reference)
- auto-dispatch PR #11697
title: Add microarchitecture specific flags for Intel compilers
